text: A source textJCU â€“ Primary, Secondary & Tertiary Sources is a piece of work (usually writing, sometimes speech) where information or ideas come from. In translation, a source text is the original text that is to be translated into another language. In the study of history, people talk about primary (firsthand), secondary (secondhand) and tertiary (thirdhand) sources. == References == Category:Translation Category:History Category:Academia
title: Source text
